Text.Page: The Mysterium enlisted your help to make a strike on the Cyasma Spire, an argon structure teeming with energy. Inside, you encountered the sole survivor of an earlier mission, infiltrated the spire, and destroyed much of the argon infrastructure. You also drew the attention of someone powerful indeed.
{@Creature:249#2006$$Celtan} says the argons started multiplying when that {@Rgn:49003$$Agnurok Engine} appeared. You might find an answer inside.

Long time no see, my friend. This site might well be the most important outpost in Northern Shara.

If we're right, much of the energy that drives the argon war machine lies inside...and we're going to take it out. Take this reverse transducer. It should invert the energy's polarity—killing who knows how many argons."Fantastic!"
Indeed. Of course, much of our plan rests upon untested hypotheses, but perhaps someone who's battled gods—and survived—is up to a little improvisation, eh?

I haven't thanked you yet for your help at the Melgatol Portal.

I'm stronger now, largely due to your support. So, thanks.

Ronalt's bold little plan requires us to infiltrate this structure. Think I'm ready?
(You feel a tingle across your skin as you approach the teleportal.)

Argh...my aching head. Nature hurts.

Watch yourself in here. The argons don't fool around. My squad barely got to the next chamber. Stick to the side passages. You might avoid fighting altogether.

Take out the cyasma coils, and then use the transducer. Good luck.

We heard the argons' screams. You really hit them where it counts.

You've given us new hope, . Thank you.
The scribes had best learn your name, my friend, because you're forging a legend every time you take the field.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"I'm just doing my duty."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Come now, no false modesty. You're a damned fine soldier.

Look, I need you to head to Granarkus. The Mysterium reported new readings from what they're calling the argon queen.

Imagine it. If we can take her down, we can end this war!
